bugs.title: CVE-2012-4219 CVE-2012-4345 phpMyAdmin-3.5.2.2 is available (PMASA-2012-3, PMASA-2012-4)

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2012-4219 CVE-2012-4345 phpMyAdmin-3.5.2.2 is available (PMASA-2012-3, PMASA-2012-4)

long_desc.thetext:
Latest upstream release: 3.5.2.1
Current version in Fedora Rawhide: 3.5.2
URL: http://www.phpmyadmin.net/home_page/downloads.php

Please consult the package updates policy before you issue an update to a stable branch: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Updates_Policy

More information about the service that created this bug can be found at:
https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Upstream_release_monitoring

Latest upstream release: 3.5.2.2
Current version in Fedora Rawhide: 3.5.2
URL: http://www.phpmyadmin.net/home_page/downloads.php

Please consult the package updates policy before you issue an update to a stable branch: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Updates_Policy

More information about the service that created this bug can be found at:
https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Upstream_release_monitoring

phpMyAdmin-3.5.2.2-1.fc18 has been submitted as an update for Fedora 18.
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/phpMyAdmin-3.5.2.2-1.fc18

phpMyAdmin-3.5.2.2-1.fc17 has been submitted as an update for Fedora 17.
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/phpMyAdmin-3.5.2.2-1.fc17

phpMyAdmin-3.5.2.2-1.fc16 has been submitted as an update for Fedora 16.
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/phpMyAdmin-3.5.2.2-1.fc16

phpMyAdmin-3.5.2.2-1.el6 has been submitted as an update for Fedora EPEL 6.
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/phpMyAdmin-3.5.2.2-1.el6

phpMyAdmin3-3.5.2.2-1.el5 has been submitted as an update for Fedora EPEL 5.
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/phpMyAdmin3-3.5.2.2-1.el5

Package phpMyAdmin-3.5.2.2-1.fc18:
* should fix your issue,
* was pushed to the Fedora 18 testing repository,
* should be available at your local mirror within two days.
Update it with:
# su -c 'yum update --enablerepo=updates-testing phpMyAdmin-3.5.2.2-1.fc18'
as soon as you are able to.
Please go to the following url:
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2012-11962/phpMyAdmin-3.5.2.2-1.fc18
then log in and leave karma (feedback).

The PMASA-2012-3: http://www.phpmyadmin.net/home_page/security/PMASA-2012-3.php
got CVE identifier of CVE-2012-4219.

The PMASA-2012-4: http://www.phpmyadmin.net/home_page/security/PMASA-2012-4.php got CVE identifier of CVE-2012-4345.
phpMyAdmin-3.5.2.2-1.fc17 has been pushed to the Fedora 17 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
phpMyAdmin-3.5.2.2-1.fc16 has been pushed to the Fedora 16 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
phpMyAdmin-3.5.2.2-1.el6 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
phpMyAdmin3-3.5.2.2-1.el5 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 5 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
phpMyAdmin-3.5.2.2-1.fc18 has been pushed to the Fedora 18 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

comments.text: This update has been submitted for testing by robert.
This update is currently being pushed to the Fedora EPEL 5 testing updates repository.
This update has been pushed to testing
This update has reached 14 days in testing and can be pushed to stable now if the maintainer wishes
This update has been submitted for stable by robert.
This update is currently being pushed to the Fedora EPEL 5 stable updates repository.
This update has been pushed to stable

notes:
phpMyAdmin 3.5.2.2 (2012-08-12)
===============================

  * [security] Fixed XSS vulnerabilities, see PMASA-2012-4 (http://www.phpmyadmin.net/home_page/security/PMASA-2012-4.php)


phpMyAdmin 3.5.2.1 (2012-08-03)
===============================

  * [security] Fixed local path disclosure vulnerability, see PMASA-2012-3 (http://www.phpmyadmin.net/home_page/security/PMASA-2012-3.php)
title: phpMyAdmin3-3.5.2.2-1.el5
